title: SCF Partners, Viburnum keep stakes in MPC Kinetic
text:
US private equity firm SCF Partners and Perth's Viburnum Funds are looking to sell 35 per cent of their shares in coal seam gas services business MPC Kinetic as part of the company's sharemarket float.

According to details sent to fund managers - and first reported by Street Talk on Wednesday - MPC Kinetic will seek to raise $228.5 million in a deal valuing it at about $450 million on a market capitalisation basis.

The proceeds will be split between major investors SCF and Viburnum, who plan to take some funds off the table, and a primary raising for the business, which makes most of its revenue and earnings working for big gas companies in Queensland.

MPC Kinetic has long-term contracts with coal seam gas producers in Queensland including QGC, Santos and Origin Energy. Peter Eve

It means SCF and Viburnum will remain heavily involved in the business - and have the board seats to prove it. SCF's Andrew Waite, a 23-year veteran at the firm, is pegged to be MPC Kinetic's non-executive chairman, while Viburnum's Melanie Hay will be a non-executive director.

The company's other directors include Woodside Petroleum and Viva Energy director Sarah Ryan, Swick Mining Services director Ian McCubbing and Whitehaven Coal director Fiona Robertson. MPC Kinetic CEO John Smith, a former executive in BHP's mining and oil and gas arms, also takes a board seat.
description: SCF Partners and Viburnum are looking to sell 35pc of their shares in MPC Kinetic as part of the company's float.
